The Minor Civilization attacks you on sight and can invade your systems. You have access to simple interactions with them.
The Minor Faction will provide you with a good portion of their resources and a special action will be available if you have the best relation with them.

This Minor Civilization is providing you with a good portion of their Dust, Science and Manpower, will let you repair and retrofit your ships on their Systems and will offer you tasks to gain their good will.

This Minor Civilization is converted and loyal to you, providing you with a good portion of their Dust, Science and Manpower along with a tribute in Essence. This Faction will let you repair and retrofit your ships on their Systems. They will also recognize you as their sovereign if you have the best relation with them, giving you access to special interactions.

By clicking the "I Agree" button, I agree that I am about to play a "work in progress" Early Access Alpha version of the Endless Space 2 video game. I understand that this Alpha Version is incomplete and will be replaced by a complete version when the final game is released.
The data architecture is subject to change during the Steam Early Access period. You may lose your progression several times during development and up until the release of the game.
The final content and features of the game (available at the release) will be discussed with the community via the GAMES2GETHER platform.

By clicking the "I Agree" button, I agree that I am about to play a "work in progress" Early Access Beta version of the Endless Space 2 video game. I understand that this Beta Version is incomplete and will be replaced by a complete version when the final game is released.
The data architecture is subject to change during the Steam Early Access period. You may lose your progression several times during development and up until the release of the game.
The final content and features of the game (available at the release) will be discussed with the community via the GAMES2GETHER platform.
The "work in progress" sections are signaled by a special icon \7804\.

Your computer hardware doesn't meet the minimum configuration recommended to run Endless Space 2. This could cause less-than desirable performance or even a system crash. Do you want to continue anyway?

Warning: your computer uses a graphic card which cannot support some graphic rendering aspects of Endless Space 2. We have prepared a special version of the game, which can be accessed by right clicking Endless Space 2 in your Steam library, select “Properties”, select the “Betas” tab , and select the “fixamd” line in the list.
We are working on a simpler workaround for a future patch.
Thank you
Adds a Sophon hero named “Uthassum Rhamoezz” to the Academy. This content is unlocked by creating a Steam-linked Games2Gether account or by subscribing to the newsletter.
Adds 2 “Pathfinder” heroes to the Academy and a selectable alternate “Pathfinder” skin set for all hero spaceships. This content is included in the Digital Deluxe edition.
Adds a selectable alternate “Cravers Prime” fleet skin for the Cravers. This “Founder” content was unlocked for players that acquired the Digital Deluxe edition during the Steam Early Access phase.
Adds 2 new unique planets, the “Neutron Star” special node, a new quest, a new “Endless” hero and a new “Cravers Prime” hero unlocked by the community during the E.N.F.E.R. ARG.

Efficient, charismatic and dynamic senators make for cheaper legislative decisions and easier manipulation of the political game.
-50% [prestigeColored] costs on Laws and Election Actions
Naive executives, crossing the fine line between being trusting and being gullible, will see their companies grow slower due to graft, laziness, and embezzlement.
Out of sight, out of mind; citizens are content with their worlds and aren't exactly eager to partake in outpost development efforts.
This faction has access to beam weapons, and can unlock other types later.
Exhibiting affinities and support for lesser populations facilitates relations with Minor Civilizations.
The relations trend with Minor Civilizations is always positive
A tradition of hierarchy and efficiency allows extra Command Points.
Pursuing expensive, extravagant lifestyles, these citizens tend to squander money on the most mundane things, resulting in fewer remaining resources for investment.
Terrible botanists all around, the people are naturally bad at growing crops and making agriculture thrive.
A tradition of respect for clever maneuvers permits no-penalty Trade with factions (unless at War).
Trade Routes cannot be blockaded by opponents in Cold War
The development of innovative strategies for the military results in statistically undeniable improvements regarding troops' lethality.
Adept with materials, and possessing an innate sense of how form follows function, the population are highly industrious.
The faction is able to colonize Hot planets, and can unlock others later.
Opportunistic and ambitious by nature, the population has a knack for commerce and big figures.
The widespread lack of training in boot camps creates the need for higher end equipment in order to get satisfying results on the field.
High standards along with a ruthless and constant training regimen result in lower costs and highly efficient operatives.
Placing self-believing commanding officers trusted for their discernment in the chain of command ensures quick and reliable reactions from crew members.
The citizens of the empire are easily content with their life, and lack of space doesn't really bother them.
Non-confrontational by nature, these citizens are far from eager to be joining the ranks of the various military corps.
A preference for company increases population limits for Tiny, Small, and Medium planets.
Their love for culture in all its form drives the population's ideas and lifestyle to spread beyond their own frontiers.
By careful design and testing, arsenals ensure the that the armaments loaded on board ships are tailored for maximal casualties.
An industrious people who take pride in their work ethic, leading to improved Industry.
By making order a core value of education, the society forges law-abiding citizens who are less inclined to revolt.
Undecided officers who are prone to hesitation do not inspire trust amongst the ranks, resulting in less reactive crew members.
The faction is able to colonize Frozen planets, and can unlock others later.
Training and tech are used to Increase the exploration powers on ships.
With an aggressive attitude toward other nations, this faction's diplomacy is done with weapons.
Strong propaganda lapped up by eager colonists mean that the people are less inclined to be annoyed when their Empire grows.
Adopting a trade-oriented economy and pushing for healthier market competition results in the development of new trading establishments.
+1 Maximum Trading Company Headquarters on Empire
Master wordsmiths have the amazing ability of diffusing dissent with mere speeches, pacifying the people upset with the electoral results.

Light and efficient construction gives a movement bonus to ship speeds.
Belief in their cause gives the faction a particular zeal when they are defending on the ground.
A dislike for melee combat weakens ground defenses.

The desire to discover new worlds, the dreams of spacefaring and the spirit of adventure ingrained in the people's mind has a positive impact on their adaptability regarding newly established footholds.

The dangerous and continual disruption of public order caused by pirates roaming the galaxy is enough to bring concerned citizens and soldiers to work together in an effort to eliminate the scum threatening their homes.
The faction is able to colonize Flooded planets, and can unlock others later.
When the thirst for glory and retribution is too strong, vengeful but unprepared crews assemble in an attempt to get back at pirates, which often leading to an even higher death count.
The faction is able to colonize Cold planets, and van unlock others later.
The faction is able to colonize Gas planets, and can unlock others later.
Advanced abilities in biology allows evolving the population by integrating the genetics of other Populations.
Good planners and hard workers, the population excels at sustaining themselves, even in massive numbers.
Their connection to the ancient ways of the galaxy allows them to waken Guardians on Forest planets.
Allows discovery of Guardians on planets. Guardians reinforce Systems' Defense and Approval but also provide Influence to their owner and their friends while penalizing enemies
The faction is able to colonize Hot Wet planets, and can unlock others later.
In an attempt to spare lives and to reduce the death tolls, ships are loaded with weapons that suffer from lackluster firepower and reduced efficiency.
Being impulsive and clumsy can easily lead a single trader to ruin an entire deal for a Trading Company.
The living world, plants and animals alike, cause the population a great degree of unease.
This faction has access to kinetic weapons, and can unlock other types later.
Cunning, daring and ambitious executives can, in a few bold moves, turn the business tables in their favor, accelerating their companies' growth.
This faction has access to laser weapons, and can unlock other types later.
Rigorous self-improvement increases passive Experience gain on Heroes and decreases their upkeep.
Sloppy and unproductive, these bureaucrats make a mess of everything that lands on their desk, effectively causing elections and laws to cost more than they should.
+50% [prestigeColored] costs on Laws and Election Actions
Experts in delicacy who relish refined lifestyles, these citizens know that the best things are to be enjoyed with occasional moderation.
Uncultured, undignified and wasteful people, these citizens end up ruining perfectly good products through ignorance and indifference.

The faction starts with Epistis population on their home planet
A love of the architecture and act of shipbuilding means rapid and efficient construction.
Construction and building is in their lifeblood, and any project comes to quicker completion.
Preferring to live in harmony with nature means they feel happier in life-rich systems.
With strong bonds between the society and nature, a happier system leads to higher food yields.
A naturally inquisitive and experimental mentality provides a bonus to Industry per Curiosity discovered.
A naturally inquisitive and experimental mentality means that facilitating links between Tech Tree technologies are stronger (linked technologies cost less).
Traditions of both live and simulated hunting are reflected in higher rates of damage in battles.
The faction starts with Deuyivan population on their home planet
An ability to accept the other side's perspective means greater skill in diplomacy.
Your Systems are 25% more expensive to convert using Influence
With limited autonomy and a rigid social structure, they are harder to influence.
A clumsily charming approach to negotiations gives lower diplomacy costs in non-threatening circumstances.
A tradition of simplicity and conservative management increases Dust stores.

Through both finance and archaeology, larger amounts of Dust are collected.

Intuitive and daring, the next great discovery comes at a lower scientific cost.
A culture dedicated to exploration and discovery means their probes have been upgraded to a high level of efficiency.
The scientists use the anomalies to apply the old adage of the exception proving the rule, increasing research efficiency.
The faction starts with Eyder population on their home planet
A tradition of farming and respect for agriculture means increased Food production.
Acceptance of modernization and advanced chemistry greatly increases Food production.
In fields or greenhouses agriculture is cherished, leading to higher Food yields on all colonized planets.
Great fans of technology improvements applied to entertainment, they get happier as their means to escape from reality - if only for a short time - increase.
A culture of sports and gaming has lead to a stubborn streak, and they won't give in easily - diplomatic pressure has less effect on them.
The faction starts with Gnashast population on their home planet
System populations are happier when a Hero is assigned to govern.
Happy to dig in - literally - and fight hard means stronger ground battle effectiveness.
Preferring two dimensions to three in battle results in a natural talent for ground warfare.
Expertise in agriculture and nutrition means the population consumes less food per head.
Positive and cheerful, there is a natural tendency to be content.
Cheerfulness that seems almost brainwashed means the polls always look better.
The faction starts with Haroshem population on their home planet
The faction starts with Hissho population on their home planet
Expertise in understanding the trappings of ancient civilizations permits increased Dust yields from Curiosities.
An ancient tradition of haggling, moving quickly, and cutting corners leads to natural increases in Dust accumulation.
Hard-working inhabitants make this faction highly effective in producing Industry.
Individual discipline and mass technology mean even more effective Industry production.
Refined senses and exotic tastes from a young age mean a greater ability to find and exploit Luxuries.

Naturally high pain thresholds enable these soldiers able to inflict vastly increased damage.
With soldiers drawn from a dedicated, physically brutal slice of the population, this trait greatly boosts infantry health.

A shared vision of peace and unity leads to increased influence when goals reaching for that objective are met.
The knowledge of how to build without destroying the environment has been transmitted from generation to generation, enabling more growth.

No data too detailed, no analysis too thorough, means Science production is naturally higher.
Augmented through training and tech, better scientists mean better Science production.
Intellectual rigor and honesty mean that no colonized planet has less than 5 Science.
A natural sense of position and trajectory means natural effectiveness in space battles.
Augmented by implants and experience, space battles are viewed as simple and solvable.
Highly motivated and given high quality military training, infantry Manpower costs are halved.
Everyone wants to play a part in the empire's defense, raising Manpower replenishment rates.

Skilled in salvaging discarded materials, this trait enables more profitable trading.
Focusing on critical and high-stakes projects is where they do best; lowers Industry production cost for building Wonders.

By extensive testing and iteration in the engineering of defense systems, ships are provided with the sturdiest, most durable protection.
A naturally positive outlook on life gives an Approval bonus per system.
Real patriots that are ready to give their blood and life to their Empire lead to higher conscription rates on Systems.
A rigorous selection and training regiment means the Heroes are always in top shape and constantly ready for duty.
Experiences of estrangement, hardship, and stress, make the people somewhat discontent.
Rushed and impulsive decisions are often strategic blunders forcing troops into awkward situations where they can't act to their full potential.
The time spent on getting the visual aesthetics of the ship just right means they cost more to build.
Annoyed, bitter, offended, and angry citizens don't cope well with times of hardship; they tend to be eager to protest and riot should things go sour.
Easily influenced by other cultures, these citizens tend to be less influential cultural actors in the galaxy.
Careful graviton analysis reveals positions of adjacent string-connected nodes from a new node.
Reveals location of unexplored adjacent nodes
Gifted in the realm of logic and reason, the population make natural scientists.
Silver-tongued, enthusiastic and canny people, the new generation traders are incredibly valuable assets in Trading Companies for the extra profit they bring in.
Uncertain what they might find in the vast reaches of the cosmos, fleets journey with caution.

Gifted with the particularly versatile talent of seamlessly adapting to any group or situation, the population of the empire is never caught off guard, regardless of their relations with other empires.
While letting young, fresh-out-of-school scientists participate in new research is great for them, it is often at the cost of slower development caused by their inexperience.

Inflation is a small multiplier applied to dust[dust] expenditures. Inflation affects marketplace transactions, the costs of buyouts, ships repairs, and ships upgrades. The inflation is based on the total amount of Dust[dust] produced in the galaxy. The higher this total amount, the higher the inflation factor.

The total Approval of your empire, calculated as an average of star system Approval ratings weighted by population. High and low approval values can influence the [scienceColored] and [dustColored] outputs of your star systems.

Tip: Your system can be developed by consuming luxury resources once you have unlocked the proper technology. Developing a system provides a permanent boost. Be careful about how you specialize your empire!
Tip: Trading Companies are created by building a Headquarters. It will then create Trade Routes from the star system it’s located in to all systems with a Subsidiary.
Tip: You can invest in a Trade Company from the Economy Screen in order to increase their Trade Routes' income.
Tip: Minor Civilizations provide a Faction Trait once assimilated. You can assimilate through war, or by using your Influence.
Tip: A part of your growth is converted every turn to fill your Manpower. It is then used by your ships and systems to generate troops during ground battle.
Tip: You can use Alt + Click to force a technology to the top of the queue.
Tip: While watching a Space Battle, you can accelerate (+), slow down (-) or pause (Pause) the sequence. You can still navigate with the Free Camera.
Tip: To Colonize a System, you must first create an Outpost on one of its planets, and populate it using Outpost Actions.
Tip: Exploration ships can use Probes to either reveal Curiosities or look for isolated star systems.
Tip: To Colonize a System, you must first create an Outpost on one of its planets, and populate it using Outpost Actions.
Tip: You can activate the tutorial at any time through the game options.
Tip: The border of your empire grows depending on the influence of your systems. The more a system produces, the faster its border expands.
Tip: Each political ideology provides a mandatory law, guiding your strategy. In addition, you can vote more laws from the elected parties.
Tip: Cravers start as an Autocracy. Only a single party is permitted in the Senate, only the Main Population votes, and Anarchy cannot occur.

Endless and even pre-Endless artifacts are all the rage; interest in {0} plummets, stocks increase and prices drop.
A lull in galactic construction leads to oversupply of {0}; stocks increase and prices drop.
A cloth trading company goes bust and dumps its reserves of {0} on the market; stocks increase and prices drop.
Contents of a trove of Concrete Endless materials rich in {0} temporarily floods the market; stocks increase and prices drop.
The study of history and use of artifacts suddenly becomes viewed as reactionary and regressive; {0} stocks increase and prices drop.
Slight addictive side effects are found for Bhagaba and Niris populations; sales fall, stocks increase and prices drop.
Public outcry at use of {0} to "sedate" populations brings temporary pause in consumption; stocks increase and prices drop.
A time of relative unity and refocusing of government projects leads to a decrease in {0} use; stocks increase and prices drop.
Clever Eyder manufacturers imitate {0} growth conditions on gas planets; stocks increase and prices drop.
Sudden fear that interlocked {0} can be used to spy on other empires causes panic selling; stocks increase and prices drop.
New harvesting techniques allow {0} to be grown outside of their native gas giant environment; stocks increase and prices drop.
Wartime DIY mentality has cheaper replacement materials being used in place of {0}; stocks increase and prices drop.
A boom in alternative and renewable energy testing causes a lull in {0} demand; stocks increase and prices drop.
In an effort to corner the market Amoeba industrial groups greatly increase {0} production; stocks increase and prices drop.
A series of magnetic anomalies that ripple through the galaxy generate enormous amounts of {0}; stocks increase and prices drop.
Extreme condition lessons from Deuyivan industry is applied to {0} mining operations; stocks increase and prices drop.
Unexpected fusion of a Riftborn experiment with Endless technology results in a temporary {0} influx; stocks increase and prices drop.

Conversion mods are big mods that have a moderate to large impact on the game. You can only have one active at a time.
Extension mods are standard mods that have a small to moderate impact on the game. You can have many of them active at a time, but be careful of potential conflicts between mods.
Standalone mods are huge mods that replace the basic version of the game. They have a big impact on the game systems, and you can only have one active at a time.

This is a cautious tactic to minimize losses for the attacking troops. Useful when you are concerned about troop survival.
More troops are sent to end the battle sooner, but they will take more damage. Useful if you have extra reserve troops.

Masters of rapid, hard-hitting strike attacks, anyone can learn from observing Tikanan assault tactics. The surging nature of their attacks not only grants more blows, it also actually reduces casualties.
Your ship will bomb the fighting area before launching the battle
A standard offensive strategy, the assault is fast and direct.
Targeting both infrastructure and population centers, this invasion strategy inflicts massive damage on the system.
Employ classic privateer tactics, striking and feinting at random, keeping the enemy guessing.
Enlist your population to generate more troops. Note: Converted population is lost forever.
Enlist your population to generate Troops and increase their efficiency. Note: Converted population is lost forever.
Lower the side effects of the invasion such as the destruction of Improvements and the loss of Population
Gnashast are fiercely protective of their own territory. This is reflected in the aggressive manner in which they take the battle to invaders, inflicting heavy damage with explosive devices.
Utilizing their decentralized nature, Bhagaba can surrender en-masse, helping to protect both infrastructure and population, while lengthening the transitionary period.

Surrender to protect Population and Improvements, but organize a resistance network to increase the transitionary period in order to bring your fleets and retake the system or at least penalize the opponent.
Stay in the shadows until the enemy is spotted, whereupon rush tactics are employed.
By utilizing this strategy, troops are kept in defensive fortifications, helping to reduce bombardment damage.
Embedded deep into whatever terrain is available, the enemy will find this strategy difficult to overcome.

Created by the Endless from an insectoid life form,
 the Cravers are in the purest sense hunter-gatherers
who would never have independently evolved
the systems and infrastructure needed to raise crops
or domesticate animals. Their life cycle is based
on consumption, and as such they are capable of
digesting any form of plant or animal matter.
As their home world is close to being consumed,
they must leave in search of further nourishment.
For if they do not continue to expand, discover,
and exploit new worlds, their society will eat itself
to death. Feeding the hive is their all-consuming
purpose; the notions of 'treaty', 'trade', and 'peace'
do not exist.

The Lumeris are a society that revolves around trade,
 economic deals, economic growth, and doing business.
 Expansion and acquisition are the bywords of their 
culture, and as an amphibious people they are 
prepared to make money in any environment. Their 
society is organized around a series of families that 
have traditionally run different parts of their economy,
 and the balance of power and negotiations between 
the families is what drives progress--or blocks it.

The Sophons are a curious, peace-loving race whose
highest ideals are found in scientific knowledge and
technological advancement.
Keen to explore and understand the mysteries of the
cosmos, they believe the universe is something to
intellectually master.

The Unfallen have only ever known their homeworld of Koyasil,
 preferring to peaceably study what is near rather than
 discover what is far. They were content with this slow
 development that they refer to as the “Long Sleep”—the period
 from their rise to sentience to the modern era. The modern
 era was rudely thrust upon them by a galactic skirmish in the
 skies above, and the debris it rained upon their planet.
 Seeing fire fall from the skies, and viewing the violence of
 other races firsthand changed their image of their role in
 the galaxy. Having an intimate relationship with fire as both
 Fire-That-Destroys and Fire-That-Renews, they view themselves
 as guardians of peace and harmony in a galaxy that seems to
 be badly in need of both.

Victims of a classic cycle of over-industrialization, 
the Vodyani were saved by technology culled from ruins 
of the Virtual Endless. These precursors quickly gained
 an aura of divinity in the eyes of the Vodyani, and are now
 worshipped as gods. Clothed in their great black suits 
of borrowed technology, Vodyani leaders pilot their great
 Arks across the star lanes, seeking other peoples 
to convert, control, and consume.

Number of Curiosities that empire has researched.
You have failed to turn the galaxy into a docile source of nourishment for the Cravers.
The Cravers have claimed victory; take care of your citizens…
Through sheer force of will and relentless aggression, the supremacy of the Cravers is uncontested across the galaxy. Your opponents are now just a treat for you to savor…later.
They never understood, did they? Only Horatio could perfect the galaxy, but that dream will never come true now. Another life, eh? Now, where's that mirror . . .
The Horatio are victorious in their quest to reshape the galaxy in one man's striking and gorgeous image: Horatio!
Oh, what a splendidly beautiful galaxy the Horatio have wrought! Was it ever in doubt when you start with perfection? All hail, Horatio! Now all mirrors shall display that which is most perfect.
The Mezari Empire has been defeated.
It is a day of loss and mourning, as the mighty efforts of the Mezari Empire to impose its enlightened rule have been sabotaged by other, lesser, nations.
The Mezari Empire now spans the galaxy as its forward-thinking, benevolent leader!

Glory to the Empire and to its visionary leader, Emperor Zelevas! The scientific prowess and moral strength of the Mezari civilization have led us to our rightful place in the galaxy as its undisputed rulers!
The Sheredyn Empire has been defeated.
It is a day of grief and condolences, as the mighty efforts of the Sheredyn to impose their benevolent rule have been sabotaged by other, lesser, nations.
The mighty Sheredyn Empire now spans the galaxy as its uncontested leader!
Glory to the Sheredyn Empire and to its mighty leader, Emperor Zelevas! The power and prestige of our imposing navy have led us to our rightful place in the galaxy as its undisputed rulers!
You have failed to raise the Sophons to their well-deserved place as leaders of the galaxy. Ignorance triumphs!
The Sophons are victorious in the race to rule the galaxy.
The wise and benevolent Geniocracy of the Sophons now rules uncontested over the galaxy. It is a victory for knowledge, science, and relentlessly aggressive experimentation. Congratulations!
The United Empire has been defeated.
It is a day of loss and mourning, as the mighty efforts of the United Empire to rule supreme has been sabotaged by other, lesser, nations.
The United Empire now spans the galaxy as its unwavering--though benevolent--leader!
Glory to the Empire and to its visionary leader, Emperor Zelevas! The might and moral strength of our united peoples have led us to our rightful place in the galaxy as its undisputed rulers!
The galaxy is a tough and unforgiving place--especially for interdimensional visitors. There is no shame in your defeat.
Despite being outsiders, the Riftborn have emerged victorious in the quest to rule the galaxy.
Commendations, Grand Viceroy, you have done more than simply survive; you have secure your civilization's future. You rule the galaxy!
All life has a cycle, and this defeat may bring the Unfallen to the end of theirs.
The stench of ruin is in the air like smoke and cinder. Justice and balance wither as the galaxy chooses strife over harmony. The Unfallen weaken, and the galaxy grows weak.
The power and wisdom of the Unfallen prevail; their lessons of harmony shall re-orient this galaxy.
Harmony and growth defeat conflict and consumption; the great balance of existence has been put back in order. Let the wisdom of the Unfallen enlighten all peoples!
Arks crash from the skies and subjugated populations rebel. Woe and misery, the Vodyani have been defeated!
The Vodyani have been victorious in their devout and dutiful race to rule the galaxy.
The pacific and devout Church of the Virtual Saints and its Vodyani caretakers now rule the galaxy. Glory to its Hierarch and praise to the Endless!
This sad galaxy looks to become one of razor-thin margins and austere living conditions. The Lumeris have been defeated!
The Lumeris have won the costly but profitable race to rule the galaxy. Prepare for price rises . . .
Let the profits roll in! The Four Families of the Lumeris claim victory in the race to rule the galaxy thanks to your inspired and opportunistic leadership. Congratulations!
